questions.question: She is not afraid ......................... anything.
questions.description: Afraid is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: Are you scared ........................... darkness?
questions.description: The adjective scared is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: He is always worried .............................. his health.
questions.description: When worried is used as an adjective, it is followed by the preposition about.

questions.question: He is jealous .................................. his neighbor's success.
questions.description: The adjective jealous is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: I am envious .................................. your hair.
questions.description: The adjective envious is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: I am confused ................................. what I should do.
questions.description: The adjective confused is followed by the preposition about.

questions.question: I am sick and tired ............................... all this.
questions.description: The adjectives sick and tired are both followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: I was shocked ................................. his attitude.
questions.description: The adjective shocked is followed by the preposition by.

questions.question: She is quite good .............................. mind games.
questions.description: The adjective good is followed by the preposition at.

questions.question: She was very nice ................................. me.
questions.description: We use to after words which show how people act towards others.

questions.question: I am not very keen .................................. politics.
questions.description: The adjective keen is followed by the preposition on.
